alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Clay; Leslie; Owsley; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 3:29PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Owsley, northwestern Leslie, northwestern Perry, southwestern Breathitt and northern Clay Counties through 400 PM EST... At 329 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Grace, or 7 miles northwest of Manchester, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Laurel Creek, Mill Pond and Tanksley around 335 PM EST. Ammie, Oneida, Teges, Seth, Felty, Hensley, Wild Cat, Barcreek, Thomas and Trixie around 340 PM EST. Mistletoe, Whoopflarea, Newfound, Brutus, Sebastian, Panco and Gobbard around 345 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Valjean, Saul, Dalesburg, Morris Fork, Lucky Fork, Buckhorn, Gays Creek, Buckhorn Lake S.P., Beech, Shoal, Crockettsville, Confluence, Talbert, Kaliopi, Toulouse and Mosley Bend. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for southeastern Kentucky.
